perturbation.original_text:
1. Definitions. Unless otherwise defined in this Agreement, words with initial capitalized letters shall have the meanings assigned to such
words in this Section 1:
(a) “Applicable Laws and Regulations” shall mean any law, statute, rule, regulation, ordinance or other binding pronouncements
of any duly authorized court, tribunal, arbitrator, agency, commission, official or other instrumentality of any federal, state, province, county, city or
other political subdivision (domestic or foreign) having the effect of law in the United States, any foreign country or territory or any domestic or
foreign state, province, county, city or other political subdivision applicable to the Company or its business.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Definitions. Unless otherwise defined in this Agreement, words with initial capitalized letters shall have the meanings assigned to such
words in this Section 1:
(a) “Applicable Laws and Regulations” shall mean any law, statute, rule, regulation, ordinance or other non-binding guidance
of any duly authorized court, tribunal, arbitrator, agency, commission, official or other instrumentality of any federal, state, province, county, city or
other political subdivision (domestic or foreign) having the effect of law in the United States, any foreign country or territory or any domestic or
foreign state, province, county, city or other political subdivision applicable to the Company or its business.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'binding pronouncements' to 'non-binding guidance', the scope of what constitutes 'Applicable Laws and Regulations' becomes unclear. This introduces ambiguity, as it is not definitively stated whether the Company is obligated to follow such guidance.

perturbation.original_text:
(f) “Reed’s Intellectual Property” means all Intellectual Property that: (i) was owned or developed by Reed’s prior to the
execution of this Agreement; (ii) was or is independently developed by Reed’s without contribution or assistance from Company or Company’s
Intellectual Property; and (iii) the Recipe.
(g) “Specifications” means the specifications for the Products to be developed by the Development Committee (as defined in
Section 3).
perturbation.changed_text:
(f) “Reed’s Intellectual Property” means all Intellectual Property that: (i) was owned or developed by Reed’s prior to the
execution of this Agreement; (ii) was or is independently developed by Reed’s without contribution or assistance from Company or Company’s
Intellectual Property; and (iii) any input or ingredient ever used by Reed's in their commercial products.
(g) “Specifications” means the initial draft specifications for the Products to be developed by the Development Committee (as defined in
Section 3).
perturbation.explanation: Changing the definition of 'Reed's Intellectual Property' to include 'any input or ingredient ever used by Reed's in their commercial products' drastically broadens the scope of their ownership. This creates a conflict with the intended purpose of the agreement, where Company is contributing recipes and Deliverables, potentially infringing on Reed's now broadly defined IP. Additionally, Specifications are now considered 'initial draft', implying that they may not be the final say which goes against the intent.

perturbation.original_text:
7. Confidentiality. Each of Reed’s and Company (a “Receiving Party”) shall hold in confidence and not make any commercial or other use
of any or all Confidential Information conveyed, acquired or learned from the other party (the “Disclosing Party”) at any time, except in association
with this Agreement. Except as otherwise expressly permitted herein, Receiving Party shall not disclose such information to third persons without
the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.
perturbation.changed_text:
7. Confidentiality. Each of Reed’s and Company (a “Receiving Party”) shall hold in confidence and not make any commercial or other use
of any or all Confidential Information conveyed, acquired or learned from the other party (the “Disclosing Party”) at any time, except in association
with this Agreement. Except as otherwise expressly permitted herein, Receiving Party may disclose such information to third persons without
the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, if such information is necessary for the Receiving Party's business purposes, as determined by the Receiving Party.
perturbation.explanation: This modifies the confidentiality clause to allow a Receiving Party to disclose Confidential Information to third parties if it deems it necessary for its business purposes, effectively negating the original intent of confidentiality and creating a large loophole that can lead to legal challenges.
